title: High Air Pollution Levels
description: In 2020, Niger recorded a mean annual PM2.5 air pollution exposure of 85.12 micrograms per cubic meter, one of the highest globally.

title: High Competition from Unregistered Firms
description: In 2017, 85.1% of firms in Niger reported competing against unregistered firms, indicating a significant informal sector presence.

title: Significant Agricultural Contribution to GDP
description: In 2023, agriculture, forestry, and fishing contributed 47.81% to Niger's GDP, highlighting its reliance on these sectors.

title: High Learning Poverty Among Female Children
description: In 2019, 100% of female children at the end-of-primary age in Niger were below minimum reading proficiency, adjusted for out-of-school children.

title: Female Primary School Age Children Out-of-School
description: In 2019, 100% of female primary school age children in Niger were out of school, indicating severe educational challenges.

title: High Adolescent Out-of-School Rates
description: In 2023, 72.97% of female and 71.63% of male adolescents were out of school, reflecting significant educational barriers.

title: High Child Mortality Rates
description: In 2023, Niger had an under-5 mortality rate of 114.8 per 1,000 live births, one of the highest globally.

title: Widespread Use of Insecticide-Treated Bed Nets
description: In 2015, 95.5% of the under-5 population in Niger used insecticide-treated bed nets, indicating strong malaria prevention efforts.

title: High Poverty Impact from Health Expenditure
description: In 2018, 78.53% of Niger's population was pushed or further pushed below the $3.65 poverty line due to out-of-pocket health care expenses.

title: High Employment Among Young Males
description: In 2022, the employment to population ratio for males aged 15-24 in Niger was 78.35%, reflecting high youth employment.

title: Young Population Demographics
description: In 2023, 46.91% of Niger's female population was aged 0-14, indicating a young demographic profile.

title: Lowest Educational Attainment in Lower Secondary
description: In 2022, only 8.45% of Niger's population aged 25 and above had completed lower secondary education, indicating a significant educational gap.

title: Minimal Coverage of Social Insurance Programs
description: As of 2021, only 21.45% of Niger's population in the third quintile were covered by social insurance programs, highlighting limited social safety nets.

title: Low Female Educational Attainment in Post-Secondary
description: In 2022, a mere 0.79% of females aged 25 and above had completed post-secondary education in Niger, reflecting gender disparities in higher education.

title: High Youth Employment Rates
description: Niger boasts one of the lowest youth unemployment rates globally, with only 0.30% of the youth labor force unemployed in 2024, according to ILO estimates.

title: Low Female Unemployment Rates
description: In 2024, Niger had a female unemployment rate of just 0.26%, one of the lowest in the world, as per ILO estimates.

title: Minimal Overweight Prevalence in Children
description: In 2022, only 0.5% of children under five in Niger were overweight, indicating low prevalence of childhood obesity.

title: Low Male Employment in Industry
description: In 2023, only 5.42% of male employment in Niger was in the industrial sector, indicating a predominantly non-industrial workforce.
